intro: Senecio catharinensis, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Senecio catharinensis is often found in coastal areas and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
